Ranoik already hit on it.
A nuclear warhead is not like a conventional explosive. It requires a long chain of complicated events to happen for the nuclear chain reaction to occur. Any kind of outside interference (getting intercepted while in midair) will easily break the chain of events from occurring, rendering the missile relatively harmless.

No proof you'd accept, unfortunately. Just that the copy of the taxes is the client's copy....which doesn't really prove anything, since any number of tax lawyers that trump had on retainer would have had access to that copy.
Intercepting a nuclear missile isn't going to cause a nuclear detonation.

Reminds me of a joke.
A highly distinguished Admiral in the Navy retired, and found a job in corporate America. He would always come in late, until finally his boss had enough of it, and pulled the retired Admiral aside. In order to be nice about it, he said..
"Hey, Bob, remember when you were active duty and you'd arrive at the office late? What would people say when you did that?"
"Well, they'd say 'Good Morning Admiral', of course."

Completely unrelated story.
I was a new guy at my job (very very large office building...thousands of employees)...and my boss says to me "Hey, let's go crash a pot-luck lunch down the hall." I said ummm, ok.
So we go in, and my boss is glad-handing everyone...hey, how ya doing! How are you! Hi! I asked him, Wow, you know all these people? He says no, not a one. "But, if you pretend to know everyone, no one will admit that they have no clue who you are".
So, there we are with plates full of food that we didn't pay for, looking at the banner that said "Good Luck Tony!" My boss says to a random passerby "Yeah, Tony sure did do some good work around here huh? Wherever he goes after this is going to be lucky to have hired him on."
The passerby says "Ummm, Tony is a girl, and she's going through a dangerous medical procedure."
The look my boss gave me was priceless, very much an Abort! Abort! and we got out of there pretty quick.
Twist: They only need data for one month, but no one ever makes it to two months, so they never have to pay.
